body.p:
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

your petitioners citizens of Johnson County respectfully represents to your Excellency that, Johnathan Ward a young man formaly a citizen of this county, now a convict by a Judgment of the Johnson circuit court on the verdict of a jury brought from Lawrence county for the term of ten years on a charge of having in sudden heat killed one Nathan Cassle, has now beene confined in the state priSSon over three years the Killing occured when the convict was so drunk that he knew not what he did, nor did he remember it on becoming sober. he was young and of respectable parentage and not given to intemperence or violence, the whole affair was one of these unfortunate occurences that some times occur from the sale & giving liquor to minors his mother is a widow advanced in years & of feeble helth, he is her youngest child & she is distressed at being of his society, your petitioners sugests to your excellency that his chastisement has vindicated the Law, and sufficiently impressed him with its majesty & powered the necessity of obedience to it they pray your excellency to remit his punishment, and liberate
him, of the ballance of the time and as in duty they will every pray &c
